fields.description: Access key (aka user ID) of your account in S3 service.
fields.label: Access Key

fields.description: Secret Key (aka password) of your account in S3 service.
fields.label: Secret Key

fields.description: Region name of buckets in S3 service. Default value: "auto".
fields.label: Region

fields.description: Be careful! Please set up your bucket as private in your provider and/or remove public access to objects. Some files you upload to Frappe will be for sure private!
fields.label: Bucket name

fields.options:
Used Minio library (Simple Storage Service or S3) client to perform bucket and object operations), so please refer to it class initialization for more info:

  • endpoint: Hostname of a S3 service.
  • access_key: Access key (aka user ID) of your account in S3 service.
  • secret_key: Secret Key (aka password) of your account in S3 service.
  • session_token: Session token of your account in S3 service.
  • secure: Flag to indicate to use secure (TLS) connection to S3 service or not.

fields.description:
Only host and port. For example:
  • [id].r2.cloudflarestorage.com:443
  • minio:9000
  • ...
Read Minio documentation for more info.
fields.label: host:port

fields.description: Flag to indicate to use secure (TLS) connection to S3 service or not.
fields.label: ¿Secure?

fields.description: Select one or more specific folders. Select "Home" and ALL files will be uploaded to this remote (If done, you should add some ignored Doctypes, like mentioned within "Doctypes ignored for file attachments" below advanced settings).
fields.label: Folder(s)

fields.description:
• enabled: File will be uploaded to specified bucket when:
    • "Folder" defined below and "File" is located inside it.
    • "File" is edited and this external storage is selected.
  • disabled: If connection is valid, remote files will be used for viewing and downloading tasks, but no files will be uploaded to remote bucket.
fields.label: Write enabled
Files inside the bucket / Same as File(s) in top "Connections" area

fields.description: Serve bucket objects directly from your S3 provider using "pre-signed" urls instead of use your Frappe server as proxy. If files match rules for being returned as presigned url, then cache settings are ignored. Your S3 provider offers some streaming capabilities that you may need (streaming videos for example)
fields.label: Use presigned urls

fields.description: For example, use `videos/` and all videos will be enabled.
fields.label: Use presigned urls only for mime types starting with: (one per line)

fields.description: Number of bytes for each iteration. Default: 10000000 bytes = 10Mb
fields.label: File stream buffer size (bytes)

fields.description: Use Frappe cache over Redis to keep files smaller than and avoid calling to external service several times within time window defined below. Set to 0 to disable. Default: 5000000 bytes = 5Mb
fields.label: Cache files smaller than (bytes)

fields.options: Below cache settings affect only to public files and files not returned as presigned url (directly from your bucket provider)

fields.description: Frappe DocType File size is limited to INT(11) in database, so if you need to store files bigger than 2GB check this setting and remote file size will be used for download/stream. Default: 0 (unchecked)
fields.label: Use S3 file size

fields.description: DocTypes included here will not use this bucket for file storage, so default functionality will be used. Make sense for some doctypes like: "Repost Item Valuation", "Data Import", "Prepared Report", etc. (If you add/remove doctypes here, existent "File"s will not be affected unless you update them)
fields.label: Doctypes ignored for file attachments
